page.title: 05Belfairs Reserve:Wildlife.
page.content: The woodland management is improving wild-flower populations but bird populations vary. The{tit, redpoll, {goldcrest, siskin and kestrel}are nesting in larger numbers but the numbers of{night-jar, nightingale, {tree pipit, owl and turtle-dove}are declining. The numbers of warblers and other migrant nesting birds remain steady. { Badger and fox}populations are high at present and deer may occasionally be seen. There are few rabbits and even fewer bats.{Grey squirrels, jays and{magpies}are too numerous as they have no predators. Magpies are thought to account for perhaps 50% of the deaths among the young of other species. Culling, however, is not practised at present due to fear of public misunderstanding.
